messages.messageBody:
Here are some links that may be helpful:

http://www.draftresistance.org/

The Center on Conscience & War
http://www.nisbco.org

The Central Committee for Conscientious Objectors
http://www.objector.org

http://www.endselectiveservice.org

http://www.anti-war.org

http://www.antiwar.com

Vicki

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Draft Picks (was drivers licenses)
messages.msgSnippet: Heidi, I would be glad to help you - e-mail me off list and I will send you the information. Peace, Janis ... From: Heidi Wordhouse-Dykema To:
messages.messageBody:
Heidi,
I would be glad to help you - e-mail me off list and I will send you the information.
Peace,
Janis
----- Original Message -----
From: Heidi Wordhouse-Dykema
To: AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Wednesday, December 24, 2003 12:46 PM
Subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Draft Picks (was drivers licenses)


This idea of if males of a particular age don't sign up for the draft, they
don't get a license - is this in a particular state, or nationwide?

I've a 14 year old son and ever since he was born, I've mourned the day
he'd turn 18 and have to sign one of those papers or be 'noncompliant' or
whatever they call it. For all that he plays shoot-em-up games on computer
and target shoots with his pellet gun, he'd never, ever, in a million
years, shoot something that's alive. Mr. Compassion, he is.

For those who have researched the options on refusing to register for the
draft, what are they?
I want him to be fully informed when it comes time for him to decide if
he'll register or not.

Thanks,
HeidiWD


"wow, 130,000 troops on the ground, nearly 500 deaths and over a billion
dollars a day, but they caught a guy living in a hole. am i supposed to be
dazzled?"
Email sent by an SPC in the US Army who wishes to remain anonymous.
